result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Restitution has been determined at $11.97.  To be paid in 13CF1420.
for restitution order filed by ADA Zapf

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:38pm-  Matter heard with 13CF1420.  DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $11.97 - payable during the term of probation in 13CF1420.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:48am-  Matter heard with 13CF1420, 14CF1010 & 14CF1025.  On the motion of the State, this case is dismissed & read-in.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:34am-  Matter heard with 13CF1420, 14CF1010, 14CF1025 & 14CF1028.  13CF1420 remains on the court's calendar for trial.  This case continues to trail.  Matter remains on the court's calendar for 6/22/2015.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:27am-  Matter heard with 13CF1420, 14CF1010 & 14CF1025.  Speedy trial demand & bond motion filed in 14CF1010 & 14CF1025.  Discussion held.  Speedy trial demands withdrawn.  Matter remains on the court's calendar for 6/12/2015 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Status conference on April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
This hearing is scheduled to address the defendant's speedy trial demand filed in 14CF1025 & 14CF1010.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Defendant, Robert J. Witt, appeared with Attorney Jodi L. Meier.    Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  1121pm - Heard with cases 13CF1420, 14CF1025 and 14CF1010.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is not resolved.   Ludwig hearing may be needed.  All witness lists and motion in limine to be filed by 04-10-15.  Bond continues.  Cases 14CF1010, 14CF1025 and 14CF1028 continue to trail 13CF1420.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:27am-  Matter heard with 13CF1420, 14CF1010 & 14CF1025.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is not resolved.  Attorney Meier is requesting an adjournment to attempt to resolve the matters.  Court grants request.  ADA Braun will discuss a possible resolution w/ Attorney Meier prior to the next court date.  Status conference adjourned to January 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
